member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.HardwareServo
member.summary: Represents a standard 50hz pulse-controlled servo using Hardware-assited PWM. Maximum duty cycle is ~25% = 20ms x .25 = 5ms max pulse width.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.HardwareServo.#ctor(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Gpio.GpioPin)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: Pin does not support PWM - outputPin

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.HardwareServo.MaxPulseLengthMs
member.summary: Gets the maximum pulse length in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.HardwareServo.PulseLengthMs
member.summary: Gets or sets the pulse length in milliseconds.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.HardwareServo.ComputeAngle(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the standard 0 to 180 angle of he current pulse length compared to a minimum and maximum pulse length.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.HardwareServo.ComputePulseLength(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the pulse length in milliseconds for the given angle (from 0 to 180)
member.returns: The pulse length in milliseconds for the given angle (from 0 to 180)

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.HardwareServo.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredEmitter
member.summary: A class to send infrared signals using an IR LED. It uses a carrier frequency of ~38kHz

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Snaps the pulse lengths to their valid equivalents.
member.returns: An aray of pulses with exact lengths

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredEmitter.NecEncoder
member.summary: Provides a NEC IR protocol data encoder.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredEmitter.NecEncoder.Encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes the specified 4-byte data into IR pulses.
member.returns: The data ebncoded as IR pulses
member.exception: The data has to be 4 bytes long. - data

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor
member.summary: Implements a digital infrared sensor using the HX1838/VS1838 or the TSOP38238 38kHz digital receiver. It registers an interrupt on the pin and fires data events asynchronously to keep CPU usage low. Some primitive ideas taken from https://github.com/adafruit/IR-Commander/blob/master/ircommander.pde and https://github.com/z3t0/Arduino-IRremote/blob/master/IRremote.cpp

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.#ctor(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Gpio.GpioPin,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true [is active low].

member.name: E:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.PulseAvailable
member.summary: Occurs when a single sensor pulse is available.

member.name: E:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.DataAvailable
member.summary: Occurs when a data buffer is available.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.ReceiverFlushReason
member.summary: Enumerates the different reasons why the reaciver flushed the buffer.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.IsActiveLow
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the sensor is active low.

member.summary: Creates a string representing all the pulses passed to this method.
member.param: Number of pulse data to output per line.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.OnInfraredSensorPulseAvailable(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.InfraredPulse)
member.summary: Called when a single infrared sensor pulse becomes available.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.OnInfraredSensorRawDataAvailable(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.InfraredPulse[],Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.ReceiverFlushReason)
member.summary: Called when an infrared sensor raw data buffer becomes available.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.NecDecoder
member.summary: Provides decoding Methods for the NEC IR Protocol. Idea taken from here: https://www.sbprojects.net/knowledge/ir/nec.php

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.NecDecoder.DecodePulses(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.InfraredPulse[])
member.summary: Decodes the IR pulses according to the NEC protocol. If the train of pulses does not match the protocol, then it returns a null byte array. If the train of pulses is a repeat code, then it returns a 4-byte array with all bits set.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.NecDecoder.IsRepeatCode(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.InfraredSensor.InfraredPulse[])
member.summary: Determines whether the set of pulses represent a repeat code
member.returns: true if the train of pulses represents an NEC repeat code.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LogicProbe
member.summary: A class representing a logic probe that reads high or low digital values when an edge change is detected. This is not meant for high frequency probing. The maximum fairly relibale probing frequency is at most 10kHz (100us periods).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Occurs when probe data becomes available.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LogicProbe.IsRunning
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the probe is running.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Peripherals.LogicProbe.Stop
member.summary: Stops measurement and resets the timer to zero.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Prevents a default instance of the class from being created.

member.summary: Gets the detection timestamp in microseconds.

member.summary: Gets the read value at the given timestamp

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.summary: Read and write different types of Radio-Frequency IDentification (RFID) cards on your Raspberry Pi using a RC522 based reader connected via the Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) interface.

member.summary: Prepares the controller for card reading. Resturns an OK status if a card was detected.
